I now come, Mr. Srum, to the consid- mtion of the second, and perhaps I may say the third division of my subject also—wheth- er the material condition of these provinces is such as to make the union practicable, and whether the details of the measures proposed are equitable to each and to all. In consid- ering this point, it is necessary for us ﬁrst to review the liabilities of each province, the reasons why the were incurred, the objects which have been sought. In doing so, the House will not fail to remark that the same policy _has animated the legislatures of all the provinœs, or perhaps I should ak more exactly in sa 'ng those of Canada, ew Bruns- wick and ova Scotia.
